description: Lists the datasets for this domain.  The format should correspond to the spec at http://project-open-data.github.io/schema/
title: Project Open Data, /data.json file
Map Points - Location By Separate Latitutde Longitude Columns

description: In October 2012, CMS began reducing Medicare payments for Inpatient Prospective Payment System hospitals with excess readmissions. Excess readmissions are measured by a ratio, by dividing a hospital’s number of “predicted” 30-day readmissions for heart attack, heart failure, and pneumonia by the number that would be “expected,” based on an average hospital with similar patients. A ratio greater than 1 indicates excess readmissions.
title: Hospital Readmission Reduction

description: Also known as Medicare Spending per Beneficiary (MSPB) Spending Breakdowns by Claim Type
title: Spending Breakdown by Claim

title: Complete QIP Data - Payment Year 2013

description: Payment Year 2013 QIP data by facility: % patients with median URR >=65%

description: Process of care measures - emergency department - national data.  These measures show how often a hospital gives recommended care; that is, the treatment known to give the best results for most patients in the Emergency Department.
keyword: hospital compare,emergency department,timely and effective care
title: Emergency Department Care Measures - National

description: The Healthcare-Associated Infection (HAI) measures - provider data. These measures are developed by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and collected through the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN). They provide information on infections that occur while the patient is in the hospital. These infections can be related to devices, such as central lines and urinary catheters, or spread from patient to patient after contact with an infected person or surface. Many healthcare associated infections can be prevented when the hospitals use CDC-recommended infection control steps.
title: Healthcare Associated Infections

description: The Healthcare-Associated Infections (HAI) measures - state data.  These measures are developed by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and collected through the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN). They provide information on infections that occur while the patient is in the hospital. These infections can be related to devices, such as central lines and urinary catheters, or spread from patient to patient after contact with an infected person or surface. Many healthcare associated infections can be prevented when the hospitals use CDC-recommended infection control steps.
title: Healthcare Associated Infections - State Measures

description: The Healthcare-Associated Infections (HAI) measures - national data.  These measures are developed by Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and collected through the National Healthcare Safety Network (NHSN). They provide information on infections that occur while the patient is in the hospital. These infections can be related to devices, such as central lines and urinary catheters, or spread from patient to patient after contact with an infected person or surface. Many healthcare associated infections can be prevented when the hospitals use CDC-recommended infection control steps.
title: Healthcare Associated Infections National

description: Hospital Acquired Conditions - national data.  These measures show certain injuries, infections, or other serious conditions that patients with Original Medicare got while they were in the hospital. These conditions, also known as hospital-acquired conditions (HACs), are usually very rare. If they ever occur, hospital staff should identify and correct the problems that caused them.
title: Hospital Acquired Condition - National Measures

description: Hospital Acquired Conditions - provider data.  These measures show certain injuries, infections, or other serious conditions that patients with Original Medicare got while they were in the hospital. These conditions, also known as hospital-acquired conditions (HACs), are usually very rare. If they ever occur, hospital staff should identify and correct the problems that caused them.
title: Hospital Acquired Condition Measures

description: A list of hospitals and the availability of structural measures at that hospital. A structural measure reflects the environment in which hospitals care for patients. For example, whether or not a hospital participates in a Cardiac Surgery Registry.
title: Hospital Structural Measures – Cardiac Surgery Registry

description: The "Spending per Hospital Patient with Medicare" measure shows whether Medicare spends more, less or about the same per Medicare patient treated in a specific hospital, compared to how much Medicare spends per patient nationally. This measure includes any Medicare Part A and Part B payments made for services provided to a patient during the 3 days prior to the hospital stay, during the stay, and during the 30 days after discharge from the hospital.
title: Medicare Spending Per Patient

description: The "Spending per Hospital Patient with Medicare" measure shows whether Medicare spends more, less or about the same per Medicare patient treated in a specific hospital, compared to how much Medicare spends per patient nationally. This measure includes any Medicare Part A and Part B payments made for services provided to a patient during the 3 days prior to the hospital stay, during the stay, and during the 30 days after discharge from the hospital.
title: Medicare Spending Per Patient - National

description: The "Spending per Hospital Patient with Medicare" measure shows whether Medicare spends more, less or about the same per Medicare patient treated in a specific hospital, compared to how much Medicare spends per patient nationally. This measure includes any Medicare Part A and Part B payments made for services provided to a patient during the 3 days prior to the hospital stay, during the stay, and during the 30 days after discharge from the hospital.
title: Medicare Spending Per Patient - State

title: Preventive Care Measures

description: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality Outcome measures - provider data. These data show serious complications that patients with Original Medicare experienced during a hospital stay, and how often patients who were admitted with certain conditions died while they were in the hospital. These complications can often be prevented if hospitals follow procedures based on best practices and scientific evidence.
title: Agency For Healthcare Research And Quality Measures

description: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality Outcome measures - state data.  These data show serious complications that patients with Original Medicare experienced during a hospital stay, and how often patients who were admitted with certain condition
title: Agency For Healthcare Research And Quality - State Measures

description: Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality Outcome measures - national data.  These data show serious complications that patients with Original Medicare experienced during a hospital stay, and how often patients who were admitted with certain conditions died while they were in the hospital. These complications can often be prevented if hospitals follow procedures based on best practices and scientific evidence.
title: Agency For Healthcare Research And Quality - National Measures

description: A database of agencies listed by state and organization to provide you with contact information for specific organizations.

description: A database of agencies listed by state and topic to provide you with contact information for specific organizations or help you get answers to your Medicare related questions.

description: The PCI readmission measure shows how often Medicare fee-for-service (FFS) patients are readmitted to a hospital after a PCI procedure.
title: American College of Cardiology Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) Readmission Measure

description: A list of the quality measure scores currently displayed on Nursing Home Compare for each nursing home. Each row contains a specific quality measure for a specific nursing home and includes the three-quarter score average and the score for each individual quarter.
title: Quality Measures

description: A list of a variety of averages for each state or territory as well as the national average, including each quality measure, staffing, fine amount and number of deficiencies. Each row displays a specific state or territory, the associated measure and average.
title: State Averages

description: A list of ownership information for currently active nursing homes.
title: Ownership

description: A list of the fines and payment denials currently displayed on Nursing Home Compare.
title: Penalties

description: General information on currently active nursing homes, including number of certified beds, quality measure scores, staffing and other information used in the Five-Star Rating System. Data are presented as one row per nursing home.
title: Provider Info

description: A list of all deficiencies currently listed on Nursing Home Compare, including the nursing home that received the deficiency, the associated inspection date, deficiency tag number, scope and severity, the current status of the deficiency and the correction date.  Data are presented as one deficiency per row.
title: Deficiencies

description: A list of Suppliers that indicates the supplies carried at that location and the supplier's Medicare participation status.
title: Supplier Directory Data

description: Use of medical imaging - provider data. These measures give you information about hospitals' use of medical imaging tests for outpatients. Examples of medical imaging tests include CT Scans, MRIs, and mammograms.
